Params[3]: Gabriel, do you think Miss Luna has been acting quite strange recently?
She's even appearing on the battlefield.
Our leader appearing on the battlefield boosts troop morale. It shouldn't be considered strange.
Forget it...
With that, Roland picks up a stone and chucks it at a tree behind him.
The stone, however, does not connect with the tree. Instead, it stops midair.
Then, slowly, a hand grows out of the stone, slowly corporealizing into a body. Arm, torso, until the figure reveals itself coiling around the tree with several legs.
Eeek...! Watch out! Why'd you throw at me!
Reminds me, can she really handle it all by herself?
I-I guess...? She said we don't have to provide her with any support. We can just withdraw once we complete our mission...
...Sounds like something she'd say.
You spend more time with Miss Luna than we do, don't you find it a bit off?
N-no, not really... But I guess Miss Luna has been spending more time by herself than usual...
And you still don't find it strange, huh...
B-but Miss Luna and Miss Alpha are just the same as ever...
...Oh, you're just—Sigh.
I had you keep an eye on "her." Any news?
Uh, well... You got nothing with a direct confrontation. What makes you think I'd have any updates...
..."She" seems to be traveling aimlessly as usual.
...That's the dog that didn't bark, dear Watson.
Based on the signal we recently sent out in South America, "she" seems to be acting as if nothing happened.
Maybe she didn't catch the news.
As you know, ground relay is slower than it used to be.
Is there any possibility... that we've all been gravely mistaken?
What if "she" doesn't really care?
If so, then "she" is by no means a good agent.
Who stipulated that an agent must be loyal to their duty? Do you even know how agents are created?
Look, even WE don't know. Non-agents know nothing about agents.
That's the issue.
Roland is about to continue, when Lamia points off into the distance.
I-it's beginning...
Roland and Gabriel look to where Lamia is pointing and see the Arctic Route Union surrounded by an explosion of fire and smoke.
What's going on...? Wouldn't forcing them away achieve her goal already?
Miss Luna... is trying to bring destruction upon them all.
This does not bode well. We've revealed our hand too early...
All while Babylonia and "she" still have their hands covered, we're forced to be on the passive.
Let us wait and consult with Miss Luna when she returns. Perhaps we no longer need to lurk in the dark.
Maybe, just maybe...
So, are you still going to side with them?
Shadows outstretched, the room is bathed in darkness. The robot looks over at a mysterious figure standing half-illuminated before it.
The shadowy figure lights a fire, leaving a fiery dot in the darkness, trailing with a puff of white smoke.
Indeed. This is all quite amusing.
And with the addition of Huaxu, this has become... all the more interesting.
If only I hadn't spared your life.
I'd say the same thing if I were you.
I'm sure me being alive has been quite the thorn in your side.
But as you know, I've never really cared about it. You're still of use to me now.
Useful to you? Or do you mean the two old guys above you?
You know I can't answer you that.
Never expected you to anyways.
So, what's with "Huaxu"?
What information do you have in exchange?
Enough intel to keep you away from the tip of Babylonia's spear in the coming days.
Fair enough. Let me ask you this... What purpose does "Huaxu" serve?
"Huaxu" is an AI. As for its purpose, that is for its owner to decide.
You're right. My point is, Huaxu may have a new master, but has her master... really changed?
The shadowy figure shakes their head and nods. The mechanical joints in their hands clench and loose. Finally, a few chuckles slide out of the speaker.
So... The plot thickens.
Last question—how big of a piece do you want of the pie?
Who said I only wanted a piece? What if—I want the whole pie?
You can certainly try...
